clinical_study.brief_title: A Observational Study of Assessment and Treatment Adequacy of Emergency Cancer Pain in Tertiary Cancer Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Study of Assessment of Emergency Cancer Pain and Its Treatment Adequacy in Emergency Department of Tertiary Care Cancer Hospital.

brief_summary.textblock: EMERGENCY CANCER PAIN MANAGEMENT HAS BEEN INCONSISTENT AND INADEQUATE ACROSS THE GLOBE. THIS STUDY AIMS TO KNOW EMERGENCY ROOM CANCER PAIN PATTERNS AND TREATMENT ADEQUACY IN TERTIARY CARE CANCER HOSPITALS.

clinical_study.condition: TO STUDY EMERGENCY CANCER PAIN PATTERNS AND TREATMENT ADEQUACY.

study_pop.textblock: ADULT CANCER PATIENTS REPORTING TO EMERGENCY ROOM WITH COMPLAINTS PRIMARILY OF PAIN.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ADULT CANCER PATIENTS REPORTING TO EMERGENCY ROOM WITH COMPLAINTS PRIMARILY OF PAIN
Exclusion Criteria:
- PATIENTS BELOW 18 YEARS OF AGE AND PATIENTS WITH INCOHERENT BEHAVIOUR.
